definitions.definition: if you pay for goods and services cash in hand, you pay in cash, especially so that the person being paid can avoid paying tax on the amount

examples.text: a cash-in-hand payment of £20

definitions.definition: a system of paying for goods when they are delivered

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (denoting a box for money): from Old French casse or Italian cassa ‘box’, from Latin capsa, related to capere ‘to hold’.
